characters: WITH ELI IN THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: straight down and moving. An infinite patchwork of blasted cityscape in cubes and rectangles.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All you can do when it comes to the people you love is brace yourself. (beat) That's just how it is. The tops of buildings from way far up. Rolling out before like a gargantuan concrete blanket spattered in greenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: we come in on a set of youthful shoulders. A KID, seated, facing away from us. Beyond, behind a desk, is an AGING WOMAN, dressed in conservative attire. This boy is ELI (12), black, handsome. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: How would you say the year has been, overall? Still facing away from us, Eli shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: Good? Bad?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Normal. I think.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: Normal for you, or for a regular school year?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: For a school year.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: How was your year? Eli is quiet for a moment. Doesn’t answer that question. as he holds this silence -- we BEGIN TO TRACK around him

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Fine. The Guidance Counselor doesn’t push any harder on this.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: And things at home? How’s your dad? How’s he doing? Another shrug.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: What about plans for the summer, any vacations in the works? Eli shakes his head. And now we’ve gotten our first good at him. Handsome for sure. Wise-beyond-his-years... ... the Guidance Counselor takes in his face and smiles, pleasant. But there’s something preoccupied lingering.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: It’s okay to talk to me, Elijah. (beat) It is. Sitting across from me I see a young man who’s creative, and smart -- (then) -- but who doesn’t want to be seen. The Guidance Counselor waits another beat for Eli to take this in. When he stays quiet, she lets him go --

dialogues.speaker: GUIDANCE COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: Be good out there. We’ll see you in September.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Okay. And over this -- we HEAR THE SOUND OF A SCHOOL BELL -- th FERVOR of EXCITED STUDENT VOICES transitioning us into -- EXT. ST. FLORIAN’S - PARKING LOT - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ELI as he moves. Apart from his CLASSMATES, celebratin and WHOOPING as the school year ends -- SOME race for BASKETBALL COURTS, GIRLS Eli’s age flutter and out of GOSSIPY CIRCLES, OTHER KIDS opt for TRICKS on SKATEBOARDS -- CUTTING past Eli -- who moves on his own. Wading through all this. We see it clear as day. Eli doe gel with his peers. He’s not one of them. Setting out ins for the neighborhoods beyond. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rusty garage door is YANKED open. Eli, with a backpack his shoulder, enters and crosses for -- -- a weathered BMX bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEDALING. Sunshine. Wanderlust. Spokes WHIP past, as does -- hodge-podge of low-rent signage in this heart of DETRO former industrial corridor. Polish, Bangladeshi, Arabic a more. Eli WEAVES westward up Caniff -- skids to a STOP at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HASAN, a tattooed Arabic teen with a cigarette lit, sees coming, sweeping out front --

dialogues.speaker: HASAN
dialogues.text: You got another haul for us or what?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Almost there. What’s copper at?

dialogues.speaker: HASAN
dialogues.text: Copper and aluminum radiators. Seventy cents a pound this week.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (re: up the street) L & J says they’1l do 80. Hasan looks at Eli. Beat. Then drags and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HASAN
dialogues.text: That's what they said? (Eli nods) I'll talk to my uncle. Bring what you got here first, okay? (in Arabic) Little thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli makes his way across the 1-75 OVERPASS now. Into wide swaths of DERELICT CITY which follow. Open expanses of VA LOTS, ABANDONED HOMES and FACTORIES. Remnants of a differ era. Epic. Dystopic. Eli a SPECK in this wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interconnected shells of buildings TOWER past barb-wire g Abandoned. Busted glass, scorched pavement and litter. Eli SWOOPS PAST into view, stashes his bike near an overp peels back a section of perimeter fencing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost cathedral-like. Eli enters. Ahead, a wide section the roof has collapsed under decades of heavy snow. Vines and greenery swallow fossilized machinery guts now the hot and humid months. Dancing across ruin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECHOES. Eli uses a CROWBAR from his bag to CHIP away at walls. He slows -- peers into the hole he’s just burrowed He knew it. Begins TUGGING out dirty COPPER WIRE. Begins excavating ALUMINUM PIPING next. Piece by piece. An exper ANGLES: stuffing his backpack. Searching. Hacking. REPEAT the process. AGAIN. AGAIN. AGAIN. His haul growing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIMMYING beneath a half-collapsed door. Further inside n Eli sets his nearly-full backpack down for a beat -- -- and reaches into his pocket to grab an INHALER. A PUFF we recognize as the type carried for asthma. Eli uses it. Takes a deep BREATH reaches for his CROWBAR -- Then stops. Beat. His breath is visible. It's cold in her Eli turns. Spots a DARKENED CORRIDOR ahead. A small froze wind brushes past. Eli removes a MAGLIGHT from his backpa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING through total blackness. Eli clicks on the flashli as -- KKAA-RRUUNG. A NOISE faraway -- dust shakes loose a -- Eli LOOKS. Listens a beat. Nothing follows. His breath FOGGING the air thicker. It’s summer outside. should be an oven in here. Eli shines his light -- crystalline formations of ice are visible along the floor at his feet and along walls. He m around a final bend, frost crunching underfoot, into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE DERELICT CHAMBER. Enters. Cautious -- Eli sees something that takes him -- and us -- a moment t process. This cavernous space like all the others except: Whispers of light snow levitate past -- Adding an ethereal aura to what looks like DAMAGE done by some kind of WEAPONS FIRE. Slits of natural light cut thr BLAST HOLES EVERYWHERE. Not done by bullets. Something else. Eli, heart beginning to thunder -- steps forward. And see BODIES. A half-odd dozen of them or more -- All in ADVANCED, MENACING, OTHERWORLDLY ARMOR -- lying st about the space in varying configurations of carnage. Eli has somehow wandered into the aftermath of an O.K. Co scenario. Only we can’t be sure the players are from Eart HOLY. FUCKING. SHIT. This was an ugly fight too. Eli turns. Half expecting sir or some adult to burst into the room and take charge... Only silence and frozen wind call back. Eli hesitates. Wa even closer... ..-- from the look of these ARMORED BODIES, there were TW DISTINCT SIDES. ONE has sleeker-looking ARMOR, the SECOND rough-etched. Utilitarian beneath bits of battered garb. Both sides WEAR MECHANIZED HELMETS. Concealing their feat Eli sloooowly approaches the closest MOTIONLESS BODY, sp out across a pile of RUBBLE -- he stares at the helmet an carefully wipes away a thin layer of frost from the visor -- and slows. At Eli’s feet: IS SOME KIND OF METALLIC DEV One of theirs. Its contours sleek and other-worldly. Eli leans down... grips it. Cautious. Lifts it to INSPECT -- -- and the gesture ACTIVATES something. The device CHIMES Some kind of PROMPT, as though it’s POWERING UP. As it do -- the device OPENS. Or rather, the OUTER LAYER DOES. A s retracting SHIELD. Revealing the CONTOURS of what’s clear SHOTGUN-SIZED ALIEN WEAPON beneath -- -- then the MOTIONLESS BODY he was just examining MOVES. helmet turns, looks right at Eli -- -- and the ARMORED FIGURE THRUSTS A DYING HAND TOWARDS EL Eli RECOILS. SLIPS on ice. FALLS. DROPS everything -- MAGLIGHT gone. THE WEAPON-SHAPED DEVICE TOO. It goes SLID away from Eli and -- DOWN INTO an open ELEVATOR SHAFT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli SCRAMBLES. Slip-sliding. FUMBLES for his BACKPACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIECES of piping clang and roll down the street as Eli PE away. Backpack not zipped up. RACING like FUCKING HELL -- PANTING. HYPERVENTILATING. PANIC. EYES WIDE -- only once cleared a good few blocks does Eli skid to a stop -- GASPING. Sheer. Utter. Absolute. Disbelief. He reaches on more for his INHALER, and as he does, USES it -- BREATHES Staring back at the ABANDONED COMPLEX -- we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pedals, ghostly pale, scanning every passing face. Fo concerned with daily commutes, deliveries -- the mundane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli ushers his BMX up the drive of a tiny, sturdy home. B originally for auto-workers in the 1920s. Stashes his bik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And moves for the back of the garage to an overturned WHE BARROW. Lifts it to reveal a BOX FILLED with SCRAP metal. deposits what’s left in his backpack and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli. Quiet. Motionless. Mind still churning. Replaying ev in his head atop a sofa in this working man's living room HEADLIGHTS of an early nineties PICKUP TRUCK pull into th driveway outside. Booted FOOTSTEPS approach -- HAROLD HROBSKY, or HAL (late 50s), white, enters. A batte old Polack. Face and hands like granite. Hard lines. Wear a well-used Red Wings jacket.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Finish your homework?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Summer break started.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (recollects, looks around) And now you've, what? Forgotten how to read? Hal points to a NOTE. Hand-scrawled in bossy all-caps: DO

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Get your shoes on, I need help with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli straining, helping Hal move a shitload of cut lumber his truck to the garage in the dark. This sucks.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: -- that rush gig in Corktown. They change their minds every day last minute, had to -- pick all this up for tomorrow --  They set down the last piece. Eli realizes --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: We gotta load all this back in?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: At six thirty a.m. That is correct. (off Eli’s look) Somebody’'11 steal it. Hal passes en route for the garage. Eli silently protesti

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna steal a buncha wood?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (sends him a look) You seen my maglight? That would be the flashlight Eli abandoned earlier. Oops.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Not lately... Hal CURSES in Polish, scans the place one more time in ve and crosses back to the truck for invoice slips. Sits on the lift-gate. Squints and scribbles. Eli quiet. Clearly annoyed and looking to slip back inside --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What’s with you today? Huh? You forget your chores, I can see you giving me lip -- Hal looks at Eli. Regards him. Motions him over.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You know if I’m hard on you, it's cause the world’s hard. I’ve seen that. (beat) And a good man? Accounts for himself. He shoulders responsibility, even when he doesn’t want to. Eli nods, but it’s to get Hal off his back. Hal holds on a moment. Shifts. Preoccupied with something unsaid...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: We need a third place for dinner. (beat) Your brother's on his way.  Hal HOLDS on Eli. Says this next part with significance.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Be careful around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sizzling frying pans and simmering pots fog the air as Ha COOKS. Eli removes a new plate and utensils from a cupboa The DOORBELL RINGS. Eli turns to Hal, who nods. Get it. E goes. Opens the front door to get our first look at -- JIMMY HROBSKY (20s), white, handsome with a dash of scumb Stands on the stoop, lean, tattooed and cool with a bag s over his shoulder. Jimmy bears a familial resemblance to Hal -- genetic only

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Eli.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Man. Six years didn’t seem like such a long time until just now -- Jimmy brushes past. Rustles Eli’s hair as he goes -- Eli wincing. Jimmy enters the living room, looks around as th sizing it up, and slows. Then. Jimmy sees, crosses toward Hal in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Pops. Hal looks up, eyes his son standing in the doorway. Wary

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: This is just for a week or two.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I know. An unspoken sentiment hangs thick between these two. Hal cautiously nods.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Eli can set you up in the office.  10.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Office?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: a completely empty bedroom with a desk in it. Barr Jimmy shakes his head. Tosses his bag onto a dusty futon turns to Eli. Looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So. What's your deal these days? Eli shrugs. Beat. Jimmy does the gesture right back.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: That? That’s your deal? You remember me at all?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How old were you when I left?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Which time? Jimmy snickers. Looks Eli over and grins. A mischievous g flashing. Jimmy then pushes past Eli into --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Let’s see what you did, huh? To my digs. ELI'S ROOM. Enters without permission. Jimmy scans walls space charts, original artwork and drawings, sketches of other planets and maps... huh...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Wow, okay... .-». he turns to Eli’s CLOSET. Eli watches, cautious, as spots a set of NOTCHES. HEIGHT MARKS with corresponding D scribbled to measure the growth of a child. Written atop ELI. Jimmy turns to a second set of NOTCHES on the opposite fr  11. JIMMY. He regards them a moment, looks down -- then --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What the hell are those? He’s pointing at Eli's sneakers on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: My shoes.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You wear those in public?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I’m saving up for new ones.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: With what? Dad’s five-dollar-a-week- allowance? Jimmy slows. Notes the way Eli stays quiet --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Oh. You got a side thing going. Little lemonade stand? (then) Good for you. I can respect that. Jimmy throws an honor-among-thieves smile at Eli. Eli nods.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Tell you what. I got some Chucks somewhere around here in a trunk. You can have em. They’re almost new. Won't stink as much as those do. (then) Sound good? There’s an outlaw charm to Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, cleaned up -- takes in the space of the living roo Catholic and Polish decor. Sayings in the latter. Jimmy turns, eyes a full roster of RED WINGS BOBBLE HEADS a dusty shelf. Narrows in on an YZERMAN and BOB PROBERT. Hal crosses out of the kitchen nearby. Bringing SERVING DISHES to the table. Corn, baked potatoes and Golabki --  Hal looks Hal turns the shelf a YOUNGER 12.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (points) Still got the bobble-heads, huh? up, regards the shelf a moment...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Your mother liked em. So. back into the kitchen. Leaving Jimmy to consider a moment longer. Just past them -- is a PICTURE of HAL with his arms around JIMMY’S MOTHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eating in silence. Routine for Hal and Eli, but -- Jimmy from his bowl -- slows -- revels in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Golabki. You guys got no idea, man. None. Don't even get me started. (to Eli) Think you could ever miss the taste of a baked potato? And I mean. Not special. Just made right, like this, with a little butter. (then) You get locked away you got no idea the kinda shit you’1ll miss. If somebody gave me a blue light right now and some ice cream, there'd be a high probability of me breaking into tears like a little bit- Jimmy sees Hal’s expression and stops just shy. Eli grins Hal nods,

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Glad you like.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I do. So, uh. How's business?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Fine. sips. Jimmy waits for him to elaborate. Doesn't happen. So Jimmy nods. Chews. Looks to Eli. Who’s watching both of them, eating. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk too much. Anyone ever tell you that? Huh? Eli grins again. Hal watches the way Eli sparks to that -

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: -- those are new. On your hands. Hal motions. Stern. To a pair of Jimmy’s small prison tat

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like em? (taps each) This one wards off evil spirits, and this one wards off Mexicans. Eli abruptly SNORTS into his stew.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You think that’s funny?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Eli does.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: He’s twelve. Hal turns his gaze on Eli. Face buried in his meal.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Sorry. It’s not. Look -- (exhales ) I'm happy to be home, okay? I just wanna talk and laugh and catch up like a family. I don’t mean anyt-

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: This isn't a reunion.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I know --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You were just released. You’re here cause you gotta sort your life out.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: And I’m gonna --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So you wanna talk, let's talk about that. What’re your next steps?  14.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'll get a job.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Where? What kinda job? Jimmy wavers. On the spot. Eli looks from Hal to Jimmy, t back to Hal...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: To be honest? I was thinking that, with coming back, putting in some time for -- (here goes) Us to bond, show you I'm straight -- Maybe you could put in a good word at whatever site you're working.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I can’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Cause I can't clear an ex-con. It doesn’t work like that.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: But I'm your son -- I mean, you just tell em -- Hal sends a look at Jimmy. This isn’t gonna be discussed. Jimmy wavers. Hal stares right back. Beat. So Jimmy grabs fork. Fishing through his meal. STABBING carrots --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Great. So. Six years gone, no word, no visit --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I visited.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Once. To let me know ma passed. Six years! I come home, no complaints, ask for one favor and it turns out you'd rather see me flipping burgers --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: It’s a start.  15.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Flipping burgers?!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Anything's better than being a thief. A low life. Jimmy halts. That stung. Looks at Hal, staring back.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna step out. Got a few people to see. Jimmy slides his chair back LOUD, brings his plate to the sink. Grabs his coat, a spare key, and he's gone. Eli, he still low, waits a moment... looks to Hal...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (growls) Chores. Then bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WESTLAND. Just shy of Canton. Called wasteland by locals a reason. A downriver sprawl transformed by River Rouge p runoff into a hick meth paradise. A CAB pulls past us -- Jimmy gets out -- crosses the street. A group of TEENAGER across the street is going at it -- a BRAWL on a LAWN -- Two dead-eyed CONS lean off a stoop ahead. Tattoos depict valknots and the numbers 14 and 88. The SCARIER one eyes Jimmy’s approach --

dialogues.speaker: SCARY
dialogues.text: What you looking for, man?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Just finished a bid out in Jackson. Uh. Taylor's expecting me to come through... he here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHIT HOLE topped off with a brand new PS4 and FLAT-SCRE Cigarette-burned furniture everywhere. JUNKIES loiter lik zombies. Filthy. Swimming in drug paraphernalia. Cheery M plays loudly. Jimmy's led by a YOUNG GRUBBY WOMAN. Either sleep-deprive high -- through a gross KITCHEN, passing YOUNG TEENS coun CASH out on a folding table. To a STAIRWELL --  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, doing his best calm walk, descends into an unfinis cement dungeon. Oddly packed with SHIPPING CRATES and -- -- prying each one open with a crowbar is TAYLOR BOLEK (3 a grimy Aryan con with a leaning gate and cleft lip.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (smiles) Hrobsky! Welcome home, man -- you remember my brother Dutch? Jimmy nods to DUTCH (30s), seated atop a crate nearby -- bigger, Cro-Magnon version of Taylor. Staring murder.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. How’s it goin, I uh -- Jimmy's spotted this basement's THIRD OCCUPANT. A SHIRTLE GUY, beat to shit -- FACING the corner, bleeding from his ear.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Oh that’s Renny. Don't worry about him, he's in time-out. The guy wobbles. The recipient of a very recent beating -

dialogues.speaker: RENNY
dialogues.text: Tay man, come on --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hey! What'd I tell you??

dialogues.speaker: RENNY
dialogues.text: -- my ear's bleeding, man...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: PUT YOUR NOSE back in that corner right fuckin now, you hear me?? Contemplate your shitty attitude. Jimmy watches this exchange -- looks again to DUTCH -- wh GLARING at Jimmy. Taylor turns back to the shipping crate

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: So Jimmy. You wanna toast a spliff or get right to it? Taylor RIPS the top of the crate off -- pulls a MACHINE G out into open view. This crate is FULL of them. Isreali-m Jimmy chokes out a tense smile --  17.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Not quite time to toast yet for me - - I know, I uh. I owe you guys money, which -- I'm taking real serious... The temperature of the room seems to drop a few degrees.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: So you don’t got the sixty?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No, but -- I want you to see, I’m not dodging you guys --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Man. That's a real bummer. Taylor begins loading machine guns into smaller boxes lab SALSA -- where Dutch looks ready to take Jimmy’s head off

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: See, Jimmy -- me and my brother -- (lots and lots of guns) We don’t, ah. Project illusions about who we are and what we do, you know? We made it clear from day one, post charges or what have you, how we operate on loans, cause there are guys who do business like you, and guys who do business like us -- (turns ) Jail can be a nasty place. You needed protection out in Jackson and we were there for you. Taylor slows. Takes a mag. Fishes for a box of rounds, st loading it. Smiling away.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There some funny language about that you didn't understand? Some kinda fine print problem? CLICK-CLACK. The MACHINE GUN in Taylor's hands is loaded He takes a step in toward Jimmy --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: N. No man -- that, that’s --

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We know you got that father, a colored little brother...  18.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (postures ) We could go collect from them? Jimmy's scrambling. FAST for a lifeboat here and --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: -- Taylor. Man. (-- folds) I said I didn't have it here -- not that I don't have it. Taylor holds. Stays put. Right in Jimmy’s face. Smiling..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in what we can best make out at first as a dark spa LIGHTS, unearthly, glow in abstract -- HUMMING. Brighter. This glow gathers, PULSING upward along CONCRETE WALLS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Eli wakes up. Lying in bed. The HUMMING still ring lightly in his ears... After a moment -- he sits up, unable to shake the dream..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli PEDALS. A DUFFLE BAG slung over his shoulders. ADRENA spiking. A kid who shouldn’t be out in a neighborhood thi tough this late. Scary -- A TRIO of HOODS CALL OUT from a GAS STATION as he passes, faces lit only by the cherries of dragged cigarettes --

dialogues.speaker: HOODS, ETC
dialogues.text: Yo -- 1il man! Hey! Come here real quick -- Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli skids to a stop. No one’s visible in sight. Street li don't work out here. VACANT STRUCTURES linger now like cr monsters dozing in hunkered down silence. Haunting. The MASSIVE ABANDONED COMPLEX is right where we left it.  19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli enters. Moving through the MASSIVE SPACE. Every step in the black. Eli wades further --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: HAL'S MAGLIGHT. Right where it was dropped. Eli pi it up. CLICKS it on and TURNS, SCANS the open air and -- The aftermath of what we witnessed earlier is 100% GONE. No ice formations. No strange, FALLEN ARMORED ALIEN SOLDI Like no one was ever here. Eli WHIRLS. Aims his flashligh the walls, the ceiling, the floor -- SCORCH MARKS and HOL left by the WEAPONS’ FIRE remain, but if we're being hone A naysayer could call those anything. Eli turns to THE OPEN ELEVATOR SHAFT. Where THE WEAPON we SLIDING... he crosses -- leans over the edge -- Three stories straight down into shadow. Eli wavers... GR his DUFFLE. CLIMBS down and in. SCALING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
