dialogues.text: Get your shit. Five minutes. Go.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Let's go! Eli moves. Jimmy watches him go... the veil receding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli sets to it. He stuffs a couple shirts, socks, tooth-b into his backpack --  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy TUGS an OLD TRUNK free from storage. Pulls it open find -- clothing. A little dated but whatever. Boots. Sha INT. ELI’S ROOM - NIGHT Eli drops down to peer beneath the bed. At the DUFFLE BAG considers. Bring it or no... Eli does. Begins to PACK ove THE WEAPON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy searches out a satchel. STUFFS the PISTOL in first. Then the BLACK GARBAGE BAG. Then clothing. Whatever fits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Eli's backpack and the DUFFLE BAG with THE WEAPON tossed in the truck next to Jimmy’s satchel -- he strains

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Damn, Eli. Brought your whole room -- MOMENTS LATER: Jimmy's gunning it away. HAL'S TRUCK a set tail-lights just as -- the camera loiters -- PANS -- to t OTHER SIDE of the BLOCK. The opposite direction... TWO SETS OF HEADLIGHTS come TEARING AROUND the far CORNER The DELTA and CUTLASS come THUNDERING UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is KICKED OPEN. Taylor enters, still blood spattered, dragging his leg along now, with EIGHT MORE CRONIES at his side. It's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Toss this shit. SNICK (20s), a biker prospect looking type, STEPS forward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: PULLING slowly off the porch as the sound of destruction begins. As everything in this well-loved home SMASHED. LOUDER and --  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. And we return to this MONSTROSITY of a structure The MASSIVE CHAMBER where Eli first stumbled across THE WEAPON. And we're not alone. TWO FIGURES move into frame. Silent. Eerie. Hard to make out in the darkness -- ONE OF THEM tosses a fistfull of what look like MARBLES i the air -- where they stay. Mechanical. HOVERING. Then. T FAN OUT. ILLUMINATING the darkness. And WE REVEAL: The two FIGURES are wearing the same type of OTHER-WORLDL ARMOR we saw on the ALIEN BODIES Eli discovered here earl We'll call these figures THE CLEANERS. And we can take a guess as to what they're looking for. They move through the space, each using SCANNING DEVICES they go. One slows -- keys a command in and -- FOOTSTEPS in gravel and dust illuminate. Eli's footsteps. SEVERAL of the marble-like devices SWOOP IN overhead, slo TRACING Eli's footpath forward. To the ELEVATOR SHAFT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Cleaners DROPS STRAIGHT down to the bottom. A WHIRRR sounds from his MECHANIZED BOOTS. SHOCK SUPPORT -- The Cleaner turns. No sign of THE WEAPON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Cleaner approaches a window. Looks out through broken glass. Over distant city lights and THE REST OF OU WORLD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL'S TRUCK SAILS PAST us into wide horizons of midwest f land. The distance beginning to glow. A new day on approa Jimmy’s at the wheel, looking like straight up death. A face that’s clearly just driven through the night. His expression a void. His eyes lost. Alone with proverbial b on his hands. Eli sleeps peacefully, riding shotgun.  40.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HAL'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: The truck JOSTLES a moment and Eli stirs. Groggy. Lifts h head up off the hoodie he was using as a pillow --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Rise and shine. Welcome to Iowa... Eli looks up. Sees infinite expanses of farmland. That's

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: .-- home of, ah -- fields? Lots of fields... the amish, maybe? I dunno. (sees, up ahead) And... oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy enters, smiles -- Eli following close behind --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: All-in-one trucker paradise coves. These places are really weird but awesome. Need a shower? Nap? Fifty different types of jerky? They got you. Jimmy pointing as he goes. Eli takes the strangeness of t place in... like a sprawling compound for crazies...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Most importantly though -- Jimmy halts at the SIGHT OF THIS PLACE'S ANCIENT ARCADE.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Fully functional old school arcades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Eli are playing the TERMINATOR 2 ARCADE GAME. Y remember it. Don't even lie. Jimmy's enthralled...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You gotta picture coming up to this thing in 94 at like a roller rink or something -- a game that had Machine guns you could use to shoot evil cyborgs -- Eli doesn’t really get it. And maybe he’s got a point. In truth, it really hasn’t aged well...  41.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: -- this thing gave me sooooo many nightmares, I’m telling you.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Really? Jimmy shoves a fist full of quarters into Eli’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Here. Take over. I’ve gotta grab something from the truck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's HOISTED a clunky toolbox out of Hal’s extended ca Reaching for a SCREWDRIVER, he crosses the lot -- cautiou He moves for a CAR parked in silence around the side -- -- leans down fast and begins unscrewing its PLATES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy now grips a carton of smokes, energy drinks and a b of chips on the counter. He turns as Eli walks up --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What'd you get? -- Eli tosses in a bag of combos and a 20 oz coke. Jimmy hurriedly with a new hundred dollar bill -- Eli idles, meanwhile, looks into a nearby dining area -- Where A FAMILY OF FOUR, a MOTHER, FATHER and TWO SONS rig around Eli’s age, are eating together. Gabbing. Very likely also on vacation. But in a way that tells us: This is a happy, functional family. The moment’s INTERRUP as Jimmy slaps Eli’s combos and soda into his hands --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: C’mon -- the open road is calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: we’re moving up the short hallway en route toward’ Taylor’s gross and disgusting kitchen. TAYLOR -- with his leg crudely bandaged, is seated atop h battered, cigarette burned table, facing away from us.  42. The curtains are closed. Light from outside fights its wa via JAGGED SLIVERS here and there -- What sounds at first like LOUD BREATHS coming from Taylor become SOBS. Weird whimpers GASPING out between -- WE MOVE around him now until we can see his face. Tears a hurt and loss swilling outward past bloodshot eyes and a tweaker’s stare. Taylor STANDS, PACES -- movements errati Growing moreso. Caged. Until he turns, EXPLODES -- FLIPS TABLE -- as it CARTWHEELS we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Eli DRIVE. TRAVERSING the featureless endlessne that is this section of the country. MUSIC PLAYS. Eli wea pair of what look like Hal's sunglasses. Eating combos. The silence gnaws a little at Jimmy, checks the rear view again, and then --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So. You got a girlfriend? Eli looks at him. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: That's either the best or worst response that's ever been given to that question. (beat) Do you really not know? Eli looks at Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It's none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: But I'm family. You can share that shit with me -- (Eli stays quiet) Don't get me wrong -- I'd be up for telling you about my love life, but I just got out of prison. All my shit ranges from uncomfortable to downright terrifying. No? (still nothing) Suit yourself -- so there was this Spanish guy, right? Spanish-ish.  43.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Named Rafi -- who kept sneaking me smokes all the time and I'm like, why's this guy being so nice to me? One day I’m in the shower, minding my own business and he comes up to me all like -- (sleezy) Yo man, ay. Gimme a back rub, son. And I’m like --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Ahh -- STOP. Please. Just stop -- Jimmy looks at Eli. Beat. Shit-eating grin flashing forwa again. Eli, annoyed, goes back to his combos --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You don’t wanna hear the rest a’my story? It’s got a happy ending -- (beat, grinning) -- get it? Are you old enough to get that? Eli looks at Jimmy. Beat. After a moment, Eli shakes his and grins. Outside, they pass a SIGN: WELCOME TO NEBRASKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: We're parked. Carefully around the side out of vie from the road. Jimmy reaches into his satchel for the BLA PLASTIC BAG filled with money -- He makes sure Eli's not watching, removes a couple hundre

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Go to town. Sky’s the limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Eli are standing in front of a vending machine.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I had combos for lunch --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Heaven right? C’mon. Candy bars for dinner. Go nuts.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Yeah... uh. I’m not six. (nods to the machine)

dialogues.speaker: ELI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know all this stuff is bad for you, right? Like. There’s zero nutritional value here -- -- Jimmy's distracted. Listening to the sound of POLICE SIRENS in approach. Holding until they pass. Jimmy watche HIGHWAY PATROL CAR RACE by the hotel -- and it’s GONE. Jimmy sees that Eli noticed the whole thing. Offers a smi

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Old habits. (then, turns) Alright. Fine. Kid wants a Kale salad apparently. Let’s go, Jenny Craig. Jimmy motions Eli along. Out into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: How many can you do? I'm serious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Eli in the hotel room. Dinner aftermath is everywhere. Jimmy's pulling from a fifth of whiskey. Drun

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I dunno, as many as I want.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No, like -- I'm talking about in a row. All in a row. Eli shrugs. Jimmy swigs, motions to the room in front of

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Now's your chance, man. Go, go, go! Eli smiles, beat.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks if I make it to six.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Pssh. Fifty. Eli accepts. Crosses -- and BEGINS DOING CARTWHEELS acros the room. SPECTACULARLY DROP KICKS a lamp in passing. Jimmy SPIT TAKES as it hits a WALL, SMASHES -- Eli looks -- relieved to find that Jimmy thinks this is hilarious, then pauses -- sensing it. Eli crosses --  45.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (reaches ) The hotel’s gonna want their cut’a this fifty -- be warned... Jimmy watches Eli as he reaches for his coat pocket and t inhaler inside -- Eli uses it. Laughs. Takes a BREATH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the shower running, Eli's brought the DUFFLE BAG int bathroom. THE WEAPON is out and TURNED ON. Eli’s using th TARGETING SYSTEM to take aim at different objects -- -- Eli's hand grazes the trigger a moment. Doesn't pull. Curiosity growing. Eli eyeballs THE WEAPON in his hands. What are you? On the left side of the gun, along the lower barrel, Eli spots a blinking GREEN NODE. Not a trigger, something els -- cautiously, he runs his finger across it -- KR-SHRRR-VRRRP. The WEAPON JOLTS in his hands as he does. sleek appendages extend sideways like recoil dampeners -- -- the BARREL SHORTENS. Like a SAWED OFF SHOTGUN -- Eli holds a moment in awe of this thing’s self-adjusting design. Tries it AGAIN -- and THE WEAPON takes on YET ANO CONFIGURATION. Different MODES. Insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli exits the bathroom, THE WEAPON inside the duffle agai Washed up, ready for bed. He looks -- Jimmy's passed out on his bed. The empty fifth now dangli from his fingertips. BUT -- left out on the table stand: Is a pair of CHUCK TAYLORS maybe one size too big. Beat. looks this gift over -- a note on hotel stationary reads: HOOKED YOU UP AS PROMISED. BIG BROTHER. Eli grins. Looks to Jimmy -- and spots his packed satchel the base of nightstand. Poking into view is the corner of framed PICTURE. Eli moves closer and pulls it into view..  46. ... it’s a familiar FRAMED PHOTO. The image of a YOUNGER with his arms around Jimmy’s MOTHER. Jimmy must've swiped from the living room before they left. Eli looks to Jimmy, passed out -- why would he have this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Eli’s feet, clad in those Chucks. Stepping out of room, closing the door behind. They’re a pretty good fit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli moves through the space in early morning light. Weavi through modest corridors of closed doors -- Eli slows -- -- finds himself on the SECOND FLOOR. Looking down into a courtyard where a battered ELDERLY GROUNDSKEEPER is skimm the hotel’s tiny pool. The GROUNDSKEEPER looks up, sees E

dialogues.speaker: GROUNDSKEEPER
dialogues.text: Morning. Up with the sunrise, huh? Eli shrugs. The Groundskeeper eyes him a moment. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GROUNDSKEEPER
dialogues.text: There’s never enough time in the day, am I right? The Groundskeeper goes back to his work -- Eli watches hi go, then sits, his legs dangling through the railing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piercing WHITE LIGHT stabs through windows even with the curtains drawn. Eli's shaking Jimmy to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Jimmy. Jimmy. Jimmy stirs. Eyes puffy and red and hungover -- groggy --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hmmmm? Wha?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: We're supposed to check out twenty minutes ago. Dammit. Jimmy mumbles, incoherent. Fumbles for the truck  47.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Uh. Kay. Pull the truck around and I'll be right out.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I can't drive.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Sure you can.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: No. Like -- I don't know how. Jimmy opens one eye at Eli, wiping away an eyelash booger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, looking like death behind his sunglasses -- smokes grips a black coffee like a lifeline. Satchel is at his f

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Now the trick to perfecting the neutral slam -- Eli's BEHIND THE WHEEL of Hal's truck just ahead. REVVING

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Is not panicking when you drop it into gear! Crank the wheel to your left, and keep your foot on the gas no matter what! Don’t be scared! (re: engine revving) No matter what happens! More! Eli does. He's in NEUTRAL. Revs the engine into the red -

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Like this?? Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Just trust me, okay?! HOLD IT AND -- Eli looks to the dash. HAL'S TRUCK ENGINE like a snarling monster at the brink --

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: Eli throws it into DRIVE. HOLDS the WHEEL LEFT as the tru LUNGES FORWARD and SPRAYS GRAVEL -- FISHTAILING away -- Jimmy, behind him, dodging the CLOUD of dust that's kicke in Eli's wake as he TEARS away behind the wheel.  48. Doing 40 mph DOUGHNUTS. A CLOUD of DUST KICKING UP around truck. ANGLE: Eli at the wheel of Hal's truck. The world a whirl blur. Slow motion. Eli hangs on, having the time of his l while gripping the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal's truck, covered in dust now, SAILS past a SIGN: WELC TO WYOMING! We’re on smaller roadways now. Discreet trave Eli, with his window rolled down, takes the sting of whip air against his fingers in and sees -- OUT THE WINDOW: a CROP DUSTER matching pace with Eli and Jimmy in the air above -- spraying farmland dotted by WIN TURBINES which pass like looming giants -- an aerial danc -- and Eli watches, enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re most definitely not in Wyoming. Overgrown reeds threaten to devour a half-collapsed and rusted out number tethered to the underbelly of a COLORAD ROCKY MOUNTAIN. Who knows which one -- -- KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONNIE (20s) a rough and rural-looking glam rock enthusia with a big black eye is BANGING away on this unit’s close back bedroom door --

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: You still owe me rent, bitch! The door JOSTLES and opens to reveal the face of MILLY (y 30s), beautiful. Even having just-crawled-out-of-bed. Bea

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Really? Who the hell sleeps in this late?

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Vampires. (then) What do you want?  49.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: Lee’s on the phone and he says you're not picking up. Milly anti-responds.

dialogues.speaker: BONNIE
dialogues.text: He says he needs you to come in and told me to remind you about what happened the last time you avoided him -- (off Milly’s look) Please don’t put me between you and that psychopath again. He doesn’t want to hear it -- In Bonnie’s eyes now we see fear flashing. Milly takes th in -- specifically Bonnie’s eye -- and holds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milly, sporting MASSIVE SUNGLASSES, a short skirt and cow boots, exits the trailer with a GYM BAG over her shoulder -- heads for the ACCESS ROAD beyond as a FARMER'S TRUCK passes, then slows and reverses --

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: Heading to work?

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Hey Memphis, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: MEMPHIS
dialogues.text: Well jump on in. Something mean’s blowing in from the east we don’t wanna get caught in it -- Milly climbs in and they’re off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENVER in approach from the east is not unlike approachin outpost at the edge of the world. HAL’S TRUCK BLOWS PAST with Jimmy and Eli inside. Out ahead, the ROCKIES loom ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Jimmy have pulled over. Both brothers stand off t the side of the road, taking a leak.  50.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm sacked. What do you think? Should we call it in the rockies? Eli nods, zipping up. Moves for Hal’s truck. A thought co to Jimmy. He calls over his shoulder--

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What do you think of performance art? You like that kinda thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulsing MUSIC echoes. Eli stands alone in a parking lot l by neon SIGNS. Jimmy, standing across the lot at the side door of what’s obviously a STRIP CLUB, is discretely COUN OUT a FEW HUNDREDS and handing it all over to a BOUNCER T After a moment the guy nods. Opens the door wider for Jim who WHISTLES to Eli and waves him over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is everything you'd expect a place named the MINESHAFT to be. Local digs and local dregs. Mountain girls with curvy, freckled edges and smiles pass wide-eyed ELI. NONE are wearing clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is okay? Jimmy, with the satchel at his side, takes a shot with a

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Definitely a million percent. Eli looks around, there are maybe FIVE CUSTOMERS in here That and a BOOTH of COWBOY-TYPES in the faraway corner.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Here. Jimmy's pulled out a large wad of singles. Winks. Hands t to Eli.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: For the girls! Eli accepts, confused, not sure what exactly he’s suppose do with this money but playing as though he does.  51.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (grins) You do know that’s the whole point of this place, right? You give the money to the girls. Or your favorite girl -- A scantily clad redhead strolls up --

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: You want a dance, honey?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Just getting settled, maybe ina minute? She nods, departs, Eli sheepish as she passes, takes out INHALER and PUFFS as he watches her to go -- Jimmy grins

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You okay there?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It’s my asthma.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Your heart rate’s up. It happens. Jimmy maintains his grin, Eli defensively hides the INHAL Aware of the fact that it doesn’t help his street cred. H looks, pockets the cash Jimmy just gave him --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Dad would not be happy about this. (re: around) You talk to him today?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (watching the dancers) We texted. He was crashing out, had -- two back-to-back all-nighters. He says hi and that we'd better be behaving. I told him we were... (smiles to a passing girl) +. drink your coke, man. Watch the show, it's what we're here for. Above, the lights dim for the next act. MUSIC STARTS. AHEAD: the battered contours of this building give way to antiquated stage. Perfect for what happens next -- as a Y WOMAN steps into view -- the kind that shuts you up.  52. It’s MILLY. From the earlier scene. A pistol in go-go sho now, in costume, her eyes electric under stage-lights. Moving under the sway of the music -- her clothing depart one article at a time. And so it goes. And she sees -- Eli and Jimmy. Watching her, stupefied. Jimmy -- finishes beer, signals for another, watching -- he looks at Eli --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (over the music) I like her! She seems nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cuT TO: a private dance. Milly and Jimmy up close. Jimmy' buzzing, Milly's green cat eyes working their charm --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: So who’s that with you?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: My little brother. (she eyes this) Adopted. Obviously. But -- brother.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: He’s been out there himself a while --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: He's a twelve-year-old surrounded by an endless supply of pop and half naked women, he’s just fine -- (grins) -- what's your name? She smiles back. Not even about to tell him that.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No wait. I can guess. Sparkles. Milly maintains that grin.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Sparkles? I’m Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Hi Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be direct with you, Sprinkles, I have a lot of money on me.  53.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tonight I'm gonna get really drunk and my brother’s gonna get really caffeinated and it'd be awesome if you'd join us. Milly maintains her smile. Doesn't say anything back, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS. SHOTS. SHOTS. COCA-COLA for Eli. Milly's joined Ji and Eli in their booth. Jimmy's flying, toasts --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Cheers! To the Hrobsky brothers. On the road and making new friends!! The commotion Jimmy's causing starting to draw attention. That group of COWBOY-TYPES in the faraway booth are getti good look at him... WE HONE IN: on one particular guy in their midst. Built. is LEE (50s), rugged with deep-sunk eyes. cuT TO: Jimmy doing another round. This time with nearly EVERY DANCER in here. A whole LINEUP of scantily clad wom

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: To the ladies of The Mineshaft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Jimmy drinks and flirts with ANOTHER DANCER, Milly chats up Eli. She’s thrown a shall across her shoulders. are now sipping cokes.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Seventh grade. Next year.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: That's a big year --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Where'd you go to school? Milly looks Eli over. Likes this kid, the old-soul qualit about Eli. Emerging now that he's gotten used to this pla

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Where I'm from.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Colorado?  54. Milly's accent is more Carolina-bent.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not. Maybe I'm passing through like you. (beat) Where you guys going?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: A cottage. Near Tahoe. We used to go there before my mom died. Milly regards that, nods. Looks. At Jimmy --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: And your dad let you get in a car with this crazy guy?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I guess --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (overheard that) I will let you know this is only his first gentleman's club -- he’s here to become a man. We’re doing life lessons. Jimmy throws that imperceptible wink at Eli again. Grins. other dancer reels Jimmy back in -- Milly looks at Eli...

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Is it working? You feel manly now? Eli smiles, but no. Milly nods. Approves of this kid now

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: I'll let you in on something. (leans in close) Walking into a strip club never made anybody a man, ever. Your brother's fun but he's just as much a boy as you are. Don't tell him I said that. Eli looks to Jimmy. Laughing at some joke. Doing yet anot shot -- a VOICE calls out to Milly. She's up again next s

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: (smiles at Eli) Be good. Eli blushes. Milly turns to go --  55.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey! Milly slows, looks back -- to see Eli’s pulling the cash Jimmy gave him out of his pocket. All in a big tangled wa

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: This is for you. Eli gives Milly the clump of money -- in her hands -- and transaction is exactly as awkward as you can expect.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: ... thanks.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER DANCER
dialogues.text: (leaves as well) I’1l be back. Jimmy nods. He and Eli alone again for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Having fun? Eli nods. Watching Milly go. Jimmy lights up a cigarette lets the music take hold of the scene a beat. A comfortab silence in the tradition of Vincent and Mia. Then. Eli looks at Jimmy, curious about something.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: How come you went to jail? Jimmy looks at Eli mid-drag, considers. EXHALES and ashes

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Grand theft auto. It’s got a ring to it, huh? (Eli nods) That and a few other things.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Stuff you’re too young to hear.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: According to you, I’m old enough to be in here -- Jimmy grins. Touche. But still -- he’s not saying. So. El after a moment... looks to Jimmy and...  56.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I don’t got a girlfriend. Beat. Jimmy perks up. Smiles. Breaking down barriers. Ash

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: The girls at my school are. They’re nice. But. Um. (beat) I don’t know. I just don’t talk to many kids in my grade.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Lone wolf, huh? Eli shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just -- never felt like I fit in... anywhere. Jimmy slows. Stews on the implication of that. Toasts sma in his rapidly accelerating drunk state.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Cheers to that. Beat. He lets the topic go --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What’s with you and dad?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: With us?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: He never talks about you much. When he does he’s always grumpy. And he never took me to visit you.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Would you have wanted to? Jimmy looks at Eli who shrugs. Jimmy adjusts in his seat. Picks at his coat as though searching for lint a moment..

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The trouble between me and him, you know, it goes back to before you were even in the picture... Jimmy looks at Eli. Slows. Smiles a little more and shrug  57.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I don’t think he ever saw himself in me. He was on one level, I was on another -- (beat) -- me having a thing for getting into trouble only made it worse. Jimmy sends Eli a look. The liquor now shining in his eye

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: By the time I was in my teens we had our whole thing -- I mean the entirety of our relationship -- down to a sad science. It was arguments and screaming and throwing shit with mom crying -- (Jimmy slows) Telling him to go easy on me, then him throwing me out of the house, calling me a lost cause and whatnot. His eyes suddenly searching inward now. He slows. Toasts.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: «+. until one day I woke up a long way from home and I was one. We just couldn’t’ve been -- (bumps fists) -- more different. Jimmy stops. Emotion rattles up in his gaze. Beat. He loo away. Silence. Forces a smile but -- he’s angry.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What are we even talking about this shit for? We're on vacation -- why are we digging up a buncha depressing shit from back home? I’m -- MUSIC STARTS... Jimmy's searching for distraction. Sees. Milly. Back on s

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (pounds his drink) Perfect. Sprinklers is up. I'm gonna go cut a fuckin rug with her. Jimmy JOLTS up out of his chair -- Eli's perplexion over response turning to worry as --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Jimmy --  58. UP ON STAGE: Milly looks, sees Jimmy staggering this way. Eyes dead set on joining her -- Jimmy moves to climb up the low seats to the stage when - He’s GRABBED. By TWO OF THE COWBOY TYPES from the booth. Pulling Jimmy down and whirling him right into the face o LEE. Who's giving Jimmy a perplexed but unnerving smile - Beat. Jimmy looks at him. Sloppy now. Smiles right back -

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Fuck me, it's Lyle Lovett --

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Lee, actually. I own this club.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Nice place, Lyle. Do you mind? I'm trying to join the lady on stage --

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: We don't allow Johns on the stage. Beat. Jimmy eyes him a moment. Grins. Winks at Lee --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Ah. I get you -- (reaches ) Well how about -- Jimmy proffers a crumpled, gnarled HUNDRED. Drunk. Wands around in Lee's face like an asshole --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You and your friends just look the other way. Go on. Buy yourselves a nice round of sarsaparillas -- Eli -- across the room, can’t hear what’s being said but sense the energy turning bad -- cautiously getting up -- Milly, on stage, has approached to assert calm --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Lee, I got it -- he'll siddown --

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Shut your fuckin mouth, Milly. And that's a scary order that's just come from Lee. He's staring Jimmy now. All the cordiality gone. Danger visibl  59.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Look at you. Making jokes like that in my bar. How big’re your balls, son? Pretty large?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Let me on stage and I’1l show you.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: What if I just kicked your teeth in? Okay. This is real. This is about to happen -- and Jimmy it’s scary to say, but in a way, he wants this fight.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You could. You really could... (thinking on it...) «+. won't help you with that sting above your nose, though. Jimmy LURCHES FORWARD and HEAD-BUTTS Lee between the eyes Lee SCREAMS and goes TOPPLING BACKWARDS and immediately - -- the BEATING COMMENCES. FIVE COWBOY TYPES SWARM Jimmy a BEGIN PUMMELLING HIM. Eli's jaw DROPPING. Already cautiou approaching, Eli comes RUSHING up. Milly tries to interve gets KNOCKED DOWN as a result -- Jimmy's GANG STOMPED -- a total shitshow broken out --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: STOP! STOP! Let him g -- Eli's grabbed. Hoisted into the air and carried. KICKING SCREAMING for Jimmy -- Eli’s able to watch as his brother vanishes behind a flurry of BOOTS and PUMMELLING --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Let me GO! Get OFF ME -- LEMME -—- Eli's jettisoned from the bar. The door SHUTS. And we rem in here with Jimmy as he’s brutalized -- CUSTOMERS WHOOP Dancers recoil -- Jimmy’s hoisted up onto his KNEES -- Le blood streaming down his face from the headbutt, steps in starts WORKING Jimmy over -- An ugly scene getting WORSE and WORSE until -- The sound of THE WEAPON POWERING UP is heard over the mus Heads turn. Jimmy barely conscious -- looks up to see --  60. ELI. Having re-entered. THE WEAPON is in his hands. Power up and HUMMING and MENACING. Silence. Every face in the bar now taking in the sight of what looks like a kid with some kind of VIDEO GAME TOY --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Let him go. Right now. Eli's shaking to pieces. Terrified. But holds his ground. Lee spits, smiles. Turns -- a couple snickers follow. Eli takes this in, looks to Jimmy -- Swivels THE WEAPON toward a POOL TABLE AND ---

dialogues.speaker: BLAAAAAAAMM
dialogues.text: LITERALLY EXPLODES THE FUCKING THING. BLASTING its FIERY straight through a nearby wall -- AN ENERGY BLAST. SCREAM ERUPT -- Everyone THROWN -- even Eli RECOILS -- -- backward in flabbergasted shock. Flaming debris spews music STOPS -- Eli’s got their attention now -- gripping a WEAPON the li of which these people have never seen -- and -- Jimmy is DROPPED. Collapses to the floor -- heaving, a me MILLY springs forward. HELPING Jimmy up in shocked silenc Lee watching angrily as the trio hobbles for the exit --

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: (to Milly) Bitch, where the hell do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAL'S TRUCK STARTS UP, pulling out FAST -- Milly's at the wheel and Eli, still gripping the gun, watches as -- -- the OTHER DANCER who was sitting with them earlier rac out into the lot. Gripping Milly’s GYM BAG. She HURLS it the back of HAL’s truck as it ROARS PAST out of THE LOT -

dialogues.speaker: OTHER DANCER
dialogues.text: Hope you know what you’re DOING, Mill!  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And HAL'S TRUCK RACES PAST --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Stop -- stop the truck -- now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights break the surreal silence of high-mountain cat country -- Milly pulling over... The extended cab door JOLTS open and Jimmy, looking like mashed shit, tumbles out. White as a sheet -- stumbles of few steps. Stops. Milly following Jimmy out, Eli too --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Hey! Get back in, we gotta --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: You need to get to a hospital -- Jimmy's staring at Eli -- points -- to THE WEAPON --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?!?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It's a gun.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: That is not a gun. Guns shoot bullets -- that thing just exploded a goddam pool table -- (freaking out) What is it?? Where did you get it??

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I found it. In this old warehouse where I'd been going for scrap...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You found that in a vacant? (nevermind, crosses) Let me see. Jimmy grabs THE WEAPON and yanks it away before Eli can protest. Still wobbling. He begins fiddling with it --  62.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Jimmy. You're drunk and you might have a concussion -- I don’t think --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm f-fine. Just wanna look -- Jimmy hoists THE WEAPON up. Aims sloppily at a nearby HAY ROLL used for cattle grazing -- pulls the trigger -- instantly, the weapon seizes -- MAKES AN ALERT SOUND -- -- glows a BURNING RED and -- Jimmy SCREAMS. YELPS. Drops the weapon. Throws it down -- hands singed -- waving them off fast, cursing --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The HELL -- Jimmy looks at Eli. Not understanding. Then to Milly --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Maybe it doesn’t like you.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You try then.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: I'm not touching that thing. Beat. Jimmy's rubbing his hands. Eli crosses, slow and -- picks it up again. Sotto. Looks at Jimmy. Unburned.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So it likes you just fine, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I told you, I just found it. I didn't even know what it could do until back there.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Had a pretty good idea though, didn't you? Beat. Jimmy holds there in stunned disbelief. Turns. Eyes large HAY-ROLL...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Don’t just stand there, let’s see it again -- in action. Go on. his the  63. Eli blinks. Looks to Milly then back to Jimmy. Activates weapon, aims -- and BLOWS the HAYROLL into a sky-born TUF EMBERS, some of the HAY on FIRE -- fucking awesome -- Jimmy recoils, and despite his injuries and state -- whoo

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (points to another) Well don’t stop there, man -- Eli takes in his older brother’s floored but wowed expres and grins as well. Okay. Takes aim and BLASTS THE HELL ou another one -- Jimmy cackles -- looks at Eli, impressed -

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I can't believe you just left that in the back of the truck --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What? You want me walking around with it? Beat. And Jimmy HALTS mid-thought. Remembers -- WHIRLS, looking back down the road -- begins stumbling --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Oh no. Please, no, no, no, no, no --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: What? Jimmy! WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: My bag. The satchel I was carrying. All my money's in it -- I left it at the table -- Everyone exchanging looks.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: How much are we talking?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I dunno -- 60? 70? Thousand... Eli looks to Jimmy -- surprised --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Thousand?? In a satchel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoldering smoke still wafts out of this place now.  A CRIME SCENE. FIREMEN linger but appear to be wrapping STATE TROOPERS loiter, trying to look badass. MORGAN HUNTER (40s), poised, dressed up as though for a out on the town -- pulls up in an unmarked crown vic. She gets out. High heels clicking. Badges an officer to past police tape. Her badge is FBI. A MAN approaches -- (30s), her partner.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I was on a date, you know that? First one since New York.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Was it going well? Morgan eyes him. Scans the setting --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We cooking meth on the dance floor?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Statements recount an argument with a disgruntled customer that led to a fight -- and ended with gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Of some kind. (points) The most consistent description of what was fired has been a bazooka. Perhaps a rocket launcher. Which is why we’re here. Morgan looks at him. Perplexed. Rocket launcher?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Any casualties?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Just a pool table. 64. up. night get

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Jake nods to an AMBULANCE nearby. LEE, flanked by peers, nose broken, is getting patched up by a PARAMEDIC.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: See him? That’s Lee Jacobs. Owner of this place. Guys got a rep. Prostitution, gambling, suspected of worse.  65.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This can be a scary place for a girl to work -- which is why I’m not surprised that none of their security cameras are hooked up. (beat) You're looking good in that dress by the way... Morgan snickers. Asshole. And the two step forward into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the aftermath of Eli's damage. The remains of the pool table are everywhere -- mostly visible through the scorch WALL behind the spot where it used to be. Morgan taking in the scope of this. Steps up to the damag

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Wasn’t a rocket launcher. Maybe something home-made, but -- (beat) That's a scary thought. See these burns... the way they -- (points) -- ebb like that, consistent stop and start patterns -- no clear projectile entry point, just -- (then) Almost looks like a chemical burn, but -- no residue, noxious fumes -- Okay. This has its hooks in her. Morgan looks to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: This is the part where I pray that a room full of people in a strip club with no working cameras -- were at least able to provide descriptions of the shooter.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: The shooter was a boy. 12-ish. If you can believe that. African American -- with -- (checks his notes) An older male, late 20s, Caucasian. And apparently a dancer on staff, also 20s, left with them.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Hostage?  66.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Seems she went willingly.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: That'll make em distinct as far as traveling companions go. She turns. Eyes the damage one more time --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: See what you can dig up on the pair. The two males. Both of them moving to leave --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We'll need this area sealed off. No one. Not a soul allowed inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: we're looking out over the CRIME SCENE that's crop up outside THE MINESHAFT. On an adjacent incline. Looking over this via some kind of TACTICAL EYE-PIECE -- -- Morgan and Jake exit the structure. Walk-and-talking. Their faces, bio-signatures and vital stats are LOGGED -- REVEAL: we're watching this through the POV of THE CLEANE Through their HELMETS. Surveying and scanning the scene..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A creepy hotel in the middle of nowhere. Eli sits nearby, uneasy in the shadowy lobby, while Jimmy and Milly stand the front desk -- Jimmy's counting out all the cash he's

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: It'll be 46.82. Jimmy smiles through crusting cuts and swollen bruises as digs through pockets. The Cashier regards him. Unimpresse

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Forty... six... hang in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dump of a room. Jimmy's in the nearby bathroom. Eli and Milly share the small table. Milly’s eyeing THE WEAPON --  67. -- sitting out and open on the bed nearby, silent, until -- SHRK-CLACK! It JOLTS into STANDBY MODE. She JUMPS. The HARDENED SHIELD exterior snaps into place over it --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: It does that. Here. Milly looks up. Eli’s offering her some more of the SPRIT they're splitting. She nods -- He pours. As he does -- she spots -- the ugly scar on Eli forearm. Beat. Then she motions.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that? On your arm. Eli looks. Down to his forearm. Covers it, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: From my parents. Original ones. Milly's smile drifts a minute -- but maintains. Polite.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Mom or dad?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I was a baby --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: (re: Jimmy) And that’s how you wound up with --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (nods ) -- from a shelter. They got me when I was a couple months old. Milly nods. Can sense the residual heartache in that. Shi tugs at the sleeve of the hoodie she's borrowed from Jimm

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: (pulls it back) My parents gave me these for crying... I was about three. She's revealed a small set of dime-sized scars on the bac her hands. Cigarette burns. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Sometimes people who aren’t ready to have kids have em anyway.  68.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: You’re adopted too?

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Just a regular old runaway. I left home when I was about... three years older than you? Been on the move ever since. (holds up two fingers) My whole life, I’ve had to say peace to pretty much everyone I meet. Sad, but. The way it goes. Eli’s quiet. Doesn’t know what to say to the thought of t

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: (shrugs, re: Jimmy) Is this step-dad of yours like him?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: No. No way. He's like -- always serious, but. He's okay. Milly leans in closer, moves Eli’s hand from blocking it

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Never hide a scar. It’s proof you've been places. Done things. Eli smiles. Small. Jimmy EXITS the bathroom. Showered and having made shoddy attempts to bandage his face --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: (grins, shakes her head) Bad. Should've let us take you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No. No hospitals.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Well -- you look hideous. (rises) Let me have a go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milly’s cleaning and re-dressing Jimmy’s wounds. One abov his eye-brow, another on the side of his face, a few more atop his head -- Jimmy sits still, letting her work --  69.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So it’s Milly, huh? Is that what your boss called you? Milly stays quiet. Looks at him. Jimmy smiles. Nods. A thought comes to him -- looking Milly over...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: So what’s your angle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Milly smoke outside on their room’s shoddy stoo Jimmy’s blotting his face with a plastic bag of hotel ice Milly looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Don’t get me wrong. You seem nice, you're nice to my brother... but you can’t tell me you joined our little party here out of the kindness of your heart. Milly grins. Still eyeing him. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: You got me. The plan was to rip you off and bail in the middle of the night. Oh wait. You’re broke. (obvious beat) All my evil plans were for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I’m just saying you wouldn’t be the first girl to --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: That happens to you a lot?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No, just -- (changes subjects, motions) -- we got wheels. You could be after that.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Ah. That’s right. Your Michigan truck with Nebraska plates on it. Jimmy slows. Milly’s pointing his tone right back at him.  70.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Remind me. Which of us should be worried about the other having an angle?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I’m just looking, okay -- for an honest answer as to what you’re after so we can both be on the same page. (then) That’s all. Beat. Milly looks Jimmy over. A long moment. Considers... ++. and she nods. Something in Milly quiets a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: I was stuck there, alright? No car, no way out. Lee has ways of getting girls he likes to stay as long as he sees fit. Understand? (pointed) The two-a ya. Walking in and handing it to em was the first time I'd seen that happen and I figured I better not waste the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Did he hurt you? I mean, ever -- Milly looks at him. Non-plussed. This is exactly what she didn’t want to get into.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: You wanted an honest answer, and I gave you one. But I’ve got zero interest in being either saved or pitied by you. Hear me? (then) Plus I jumped in cause you’re not scary. As in. If you did try anything funny I’m pretty sure even I could take you in a fist fight. Jimmy takes in the sight of her. Can’t help but admire it Raises his hands in mock surrender -- reaches for the sma cup of sprite he’s brought out with him. Toasts.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: To us bad apples. Milly eyes him, but obliges.  71.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: That thing in there, your brother has? You should be calling someone about it.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Look. We can’t go calling people about it for the same reason I can’t go to the hospital, which is the same reason there are Nebraska plates on our truck. Follow? She looks Jimmy over a long moment --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: (re: Eli) He’s a smart kid. Whatever it is you've gotten him into -- he’s gonna figure it out. Hope you're ready for that. Silence. He knows she’s right. Shifts in his footing. And a moment, the weight he’s holding is visible -- She spots it. Acquiesces. Scans the lot -- a thought hang her eyes. An angle. Quiet. Debating whether to say.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: What if I knew a way to get your money back? She wavers a moment. Looks back to Jimmy...

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: And maybe more. (holds ) If I tell you though, and this is if you even want to do it, because it won’t be easy -- I want a cut of everything you get over the money you need returned -- and you guys give me a ride west. Milly holds. She's serious.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How far west?

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Until I tell you to stop and let me out. No questions asked. Whatever it is you’re up to or running from?  72.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to know, and I expect the same courtesy. (he nods) You ever robbed anybody?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: A couple gas-stations and a three series -- the latter’a which I just finished a six year bid on.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Comforting. What about card games? Lee runs one outside Leadville every other week. Next one’s tomorrow and if he's got your money, it’1l be there. And now, Jimmy's digesting that. Very seriously so.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Oh. And there’s one other thing I'd need. OFF Jimmy listening, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and Jimmy are unloading bags from the truck -- Milly visible through windows ahead. Pacing, brushing her teeth

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I don’t get the weirdness here -- I’m asking you to do the same thing you did earlier back at that club --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: That’s different -- Eli's very, very unsure. Jimmy sees this --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No it's not. This is getting back what they stole from us -- what they stole from us by beating me up which is what forced you to think fast, which forced us to run. How’re we supposed to be okay with that? Beat. Jimmy spun that good -- but Eli’s still wary -- Eli is silent, debating.  73.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I just don’t wanna hurt anyone.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: We won't. That’s what I’m saying. Scout’s honor. We scare em, but we don't hurt em. Promise. Promise. -- and Eli HOLDS. Now weighing this. Considering. Nervous

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hey. We’ve got a giant ray gun. They'll be pissing in their pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli wakes. He's on a roll-away cot. Able to see through s in the blinds. The sun's not yet up. Eli sits, mind churn looks -- Milly's on one bed, Jimmy’s on the other. Eli sees -- Jimmy's cell and keys on the bed-stand. He quietly reaches for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli's in the driver’s seat. Cell phone in hand. Through t windshield, MOUNTAINS roll away into forever. Eli dials Jimmy’s cell. Waiting -- hoping for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: HAL'S VOICEMAIL
dialogues.text: This is Hal. Try the office or leave a message. Eli's features droop a little, but he listens for the BEE

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Uh. Hey dad. Jimmy says you're still busy. Hope everything’s okay. (turns ) We’re in Colorado, so. There’s mountains everywhere. Crazy. I guess, see you in Tahoe. Eli pauses. A thought coming to him.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. About me stealing, if. You know, you’re still mad, and you still want me to make those phone calls I will. Okay. Miss you.  74. Eli considers a bit longer. Hangs up. He looks down to th keys in his hand, up the road beyond. Then back to the ho room. Wheels turning...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: My brother -- prided himself on being an imperfect man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYLOR and his CREW, drinking in silence -- passing vario forms of smokable and snortable contraband -- are gathere around DUTCH’S BODY. Laid out on a pool table like some k of Viking funeral. Taylor’s up front, giving a eulogy.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: He had demons, bad habits... but he spent every day of his life doing exactly what he wanted to do. He put fear in his enemies, lived and worked alongside his family, and he never compromised. He stepped on the throats of those he felt deserved it. (emotion ringing) My brother Dutch lived his life -- pure. Which is more than I can say for anyone else in this room. Pure vitriol and rage are brimming up Taylor’s gaze. So m so that even as he speaks -- the effect becomes disquieti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYLOR cooks a skillet’s worth of burnt lunch. Smoking ov filthy stove. Strung out -- and staring hate at a neighbo mangy BARKING DOG...

dialogues.text: Tay -- Taylor looks to his pistol nearby. Back to the barking do

dialogues.text: Tay! The young grubby Woman is behind him, holding a mobile ph

dialogues.text: The cell you took off the dead guy. It rang while you were out.  75. Taylor dismisses the pistol. Kills the oven heat and cros Walking now and from here forward with a visible LIMP -- -- Taylor takes Hal’s CELL PHONE, looks at it, sees JIMMY RECENT CALLS... sees that a NEW VOICEMAIL alert has come

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Tell Snick we need his phone guy.

dialogues.text: A countrified WALMART. Jimmy enters. Moves for the sporti section -- five-finger discounts gloves, balaclavas...

dialogues.text: Morgan sips coffee, sorting through ballistics briefs. He desk a raging jungle of hard copies -- flicking through i on her desktop as well. A FOLDER is slapped down --

dialogues.text: James Hrobsky out of Michigan. 26. Suspect in the robbery and murder of Harold Hrobsky, his own father, site manager for a construction company.

dialogues.text: Alright?

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: -- description of the father's truck also matches the make and model of the one driven by our shooter suspects --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Any mention of heavy weaponry? Jake shakes his head. Motions to her desk, a little worri

dialogues.text: And uh -- what is... all this?  76.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (re: the hardcopies) Zero comps. At all. So. They leave Michigan shooting off -- (checks the file) -- pistols, and somewhere between Chicago and Denver they get their hands on -- something you can fire in close quarters that has the destructive capacity of a tank but behaves like -- (searches ) -- a concentrated energy discharge. Morgan looks at Jake, who nods. Morgan’s clearly exhauste

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: So look. You're going home at a regular hour today, yeah? We were doing really well the other night. You were out on a date -- Morgan’s rising, searching for her coat --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: We didn’t do anything. You were the reason it ended early --

dialogues.speaker: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Back out to the strip club.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: You got cash on you? I mean? I’ve got change for a twenty -- listen. (Morgan's grinning) If you want to meet a good dude --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: -- that’s not what it’s about. She finds her keys --

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Companionship?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Honest truth? (she holds) I just want a kid. (you heard me)  77.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fella’s welcome to hang out as long as he keeps himself useful.

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: Really? Wow. That is cold...

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (hands him the file) Circulate this, would you? Get it on TVs with a tipline. We need any and every bit of information we can get.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HAL'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: ANGLE: on Eli, watching the darkened edifice of LEADVILLE pass outside the window. A mining town tried and true.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: The back entrance'll take you through the main corridor -- hallway to the mess hall’s on your left. Jimmy and Milly ride upfront. Milly's at the wheel. Jimmy grips his pistol -- Eli eyes this.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So I can look scary like you. Reassuring. Jimmy offers Eli a balaclava and gloves. Puts set on himself -- looks at Eli...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Boo.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. HAL'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: A massive auction complex. Scuzzy. Huge. Hal's truck KILL its running lights in faraway approach. Slows then idles to a stop at the shipping gate. AHEAD: lights across the place's exterior shimmer. Silent

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Okay. We stay cool -- (to Milly, Eli) -- and in fifteen minutes, we're gonna be back on the road with money in our pockets. Ready? You got this. Jimmy smiles. Nods to Eli, pulse rising -- looks to Milly  78.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Don’t go nowhere -- She nods, and Eli and Jimmy race off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching. Balaclavas on. Eli gripping THE WEAPON. Slow at the gates. Jimmy scales first, Eli slides the weapon underneath and climbs next -- Through the SHIPPING lot. TRUCKS with a company emblem loiter. Silent. Skirting to a stop at the shipping doors, a BACK ENTRANCE Jimmy moves for a nearby WINDOW -- BREAKS it. GLASS PANES fall inward to the floor. Jimmy an Eli HOLD -- waiting to see if there's a response -- Nothing. So Jimmy motions Eli to stay put, shimmies insid vanishes. Eli alone, Heartbeat climbing -- SHK-CLICK. The hardbolt UNLATCHES on the nearby door. Jim appears, motions Eli in, PROPS the DOOR OPEN with a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. The TARGETING SYSTEM on Eli's weapon the only thing illuminating -- we hear mooing ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROWS and ROWS of bovine. Cows huddled in pens in the dead night. Chewing, mooing and shitting. Jimmy leads Eli forward... pulses climbing even higher... MOVING through this massive corridor of fenced-off sectio toward -- a SOURCE OF LIGHT ahead... a DOORWAY... Jimmy, pistol out, inches the door OPEN. VOICES UP THE HALLWAY are audible. Gruff. Older... Cigar and cigarette smoke wafts toward us. Just up ahead This is it. Jimmy holds up fingers for a three count...
Jimmy CHARGES forward. Eli right after. Gripping THE WEAP TREMBLING but MOVING -- FASTER --  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Eli BREACH the doorway into a LARGE ROOM --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Alright -- hands up -- HANDS UP -- (gun out) Up-up-up-up-up-UP!! NOBODY MOVES -- You know what THIS IS -- -- a room FILLED with four tables of HULKING, INTIMIDATIN RURAL MEN. Each gripping HANDS OF CARDS, drinks and tobac

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Everybody reach for it! REACH for the tits'a god and hold em there or get FUCKIN blasted by my little friend -- LEE, his nose visibly broken, is seated at the head of th farthest table. Glaring. Jimmy eyes him -- -- terrified, but holding ground and feigning calm --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hey Lyle -- tell all your buddies about what happened at the club? You let us know if you need another demonstration -- do ya? Lee looks to Eli. Staring death. Eli, scared shitless but managing his gameface, stares right back... holds... ... Lee shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Clever. Here's how this goes -- me and this guy are gonna walk to the pot... Jimmy looks to Eli. Both are breathing HEAVY. Jimmy sends a shaky nod. This is your part now. Be cool.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: And the rest of you are gonna play the FUCKING STATUE GAME. Clear? (then) Lyle. I’d like my money back. On your feet. Jimmy MOVES. MOTIONS Lee up and forward. Keeps his distan Lee begrudgingly leads the way into a small kitchen beyon Leaving Eli alone with TWENTY ODD SCARY LOOKING MEN --  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee leads the way. Hands out and visible at his sides.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Where we going? Tell me first before you do shit.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: There's a safe. Under the sink. Moving for an INDUSTRIAL SINK against a nearby wall. Slow Lee has to crouch to get at the cabinet doors below, to reveal -- sure enough -- there’s a SAFE. Lee moves -- -- and Jimmy inches the barrel up to the back of Lee's he Takes a DEEP BREATH.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna open it.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Two things first. One. I told you tell me before you make any moves. Do that again I'll blow your head clean off. Two. My barrel's staying right here until I see my money coming outta that thing only. If. If -- from one thief to another -- you've done what I’d do if I were you -- and there's a pistol stashed in there for just this occasion? I want you to know: your life is right now, at very serious risk. (beat) Now. I can give you a way out of that scenario -- but you gotta let me know before you open it so we can work out a plan. So. Think real hard about your buddies in there, about any family you got -- and tell me: (another beat, re: safe) Is there a pistol waiting for you? Lee's quiet for a long moment. We can see a world of thou churning in his expression... WITH ELI: the pock-marked face of the room's SCARIEST PLA is GLARING at Eli now. Clearly debating a MOVE for someth at his waistline -- the SILENCE BUILDING -- WITH JIMMY & LEE: Hovering over the safe...  81.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: There’s a 38.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (nods, beat) Okay. Dial the combo -- unlock it, but don't pull back the door. WITH ELI: The SCARIEST PLAYER'S hand FLINCHES. Eli sees i Looks at the player. Who glares right back. Without a wor a mutiny is beginning to swell in this room... OTHERS saw that gambit -- now contemplating moves of their own... «+. without a word, we know it. Eli's losing control. WITH JIMMY: The safe POPS open. Lee doesn't open it. He slowly stands and steps aside. Able to see the pistol. Le eyes waiting for Jimmy to make a false move so he can lun But Jimmy doesn't take his eyes or aim off Lee. He maneuv and reaches backward with his free hand for the safe unti he's able to GRIP the PISTOL. Jimmy JAMS it into his coat

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Take the bag behind you. Step back over here and fill it. -- Lee's expression now GLARING. WITH ELI: Someone’s gonna reach for a WEAPON. WITH JIMMY: watching Lee fill the bag with -- There's A LOT of money coming out of THAT SAFE. More than what was taken from Jimmy. A LOT MORE. Jimmy HOLDING ON - -- the sheer amount of money about to be his. Lee FINISHE OFFERS the TAKE OUT BAG to Jimmy. Murderous.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (motions) I'll take that hat on your head too. WITH ELI: unspoken messages are now being conveyed everyw around him. Looks, then -- a nod from the SCARIEST PLAYER Eli nervously adjusts his aim -- from one heavy to anothe -- the SCARIEST PLAYER slowly and quietly easing a PISTOL from his waistline --  82. Click. Jimmy reaches down. TAKES the pistol out of the Scariest Player's hands, turns to the room --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Nothing's changed, folks! Keep em

dialogues.speaker: UP
dialogues.text: -- Jimmy shakily nods to Eli. Sends Eli the all-good wink nods. Go first. Eli begins BACKING AWAY. Toward the exit And HAULS it. A fast walk down the exit hallway as Jimmy ditches the Scariest Player’s gun and PUSHES Lee forward toward Eli's former position at the door... WITH JIMMY: Holding a pistol in each hand now. Jesse Jame inspired. Staring down the room of SCARY CARD PLAYERS.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Now, sorry for the interruption, fellas... Jimmy keeps his gun aimed. Having given Eli enough of a h start. Every second more and more terrifying. Jimmy looks Lee. Bracing to dart off after Eli --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: One last thing, Lyle. Milly sends her love. WHACK. Jimmy sends a SHARP KICK to Lee’s nuts before he c think fast enough to flinch -- he SHRIEKS -- drops -- Jimmy quickly turns -- RACING AWAY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- RUNNING. FASTER. DIZZYING. Through the endless faces o COWS in PENS. A few MOO as the DISTRESSED HUMANS RACE PAS Eli SLIPS coming around a TURN -- goes sprawling across t dusty floor. Jimmy, RACING UP, helps Eli to his feet. The two of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEARING forward. TOWARD the EXIT DOOR propped open ahead. ALMOST THERE as --—

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Go-go-go-GO!  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOLTING into the SHIPPING LOT. MILLY comes SWERVING UP ju past the FENCING AHEAD -- no time to CLIMB -- THE SOUNDS ANGRY VOICES CALL OUT behind them.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The GATE -- shoot the GATE! Eli, running, takes SLOPPY AIM with THE WEAPON and -- BOOOOOM! INCINERATES the gate in their path. CHUNKS go SLIDING away across asphalt in SPARKS -- Eli and Jimmy RA UP TO HAL'S PICKUP and -- Eli stops. He turns. Looks back toward the sound of their PURSUERS -- Eli HOLDS --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Eli -- COME ON! (clamoring in) Let’s GO MAN WE GOTTA GO!! -- Lee and the men with him, GIVING CHASE, emerge into vi on the other side of the parking lot. Seeing HAL’S TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: ELI GET IN THE CAR --
dialogues.text: Here they come. Several men taking aim -- and this is exa what Eli was waiting for. Weapon ready, he takes aim at a PARKED FARM TRUCK just adjacent to Lee’s APPROACH and -- BOOOOOOOM! Eli LIGHTS the TRUCK up. Literally sends it airborne before CRASHING back down to Earth roof-side dow Sending a crystalline message to Lee and the goons with h Do not follow us. And no one does. Eli makes a quick turn JUMPS into HAL’S TRUCK alongside a WHOOPING JIMMY --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Eli! You big-balled motherfucker! -- MILLY GOES TEARING AWAY into pitch black RURAL roads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milly TURNS ON the HEADLIGHTS as Hal's truck SWERVES back onto a paved roadway now. A glow exchanged between our he as Milly breaches the silence --  84.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Was I right? How much did you get?? Jimmy and Eli sweating bullets. Panting. Jimmy looks back without a word, opens the bag -- slaps Lee's HAT onto his head -- and begins grabbing at BILLS, HOLDING them up -- smiling WIDE --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I dunno -- ah -- you tell me? Jimmy looks at Eli, beat, breaking into a laugh, endorphi rushed -- and THROWS a FISTFUL of bills at Eli. Eli smiles, PANTING -- until -- he senses it. Goes fishing into his pockets for the INHALER --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Did you do it? Give him the message? No inhaler. Eli's now checking his other pockets. His bre beginning to RASP -- re-checking his pocket again --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Jimmy --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (still talking to Milly) I fuckin did. Got him real good too, it was --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (wheezing) Jimmy -- That last rasp has gotten his attention. Jimmy turns arou in his seat to see Eli. His eyes wide --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: My -- my -- haler -- Eli's gesturing at his chest. Having trouble talking now. What transpires next happens fast --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Inhaler? What’s wrong with it? Where’d you put it -- (off Eli) -- where'd you put it? You lose it?  85. Eli doesn’t know. And now he’s scared. Fighting to BREATH Jimmy JUMPS. UP. SCRAMBLES. Over the seat and bails into back next to Eli, searching for it --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: What’s happening? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: He’s got asthma, he’s got -- this inhaler, but I can’t -- he must've dropped it --

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: WELL -- is he okay?? Jimmy jolts. A MASSIVE WAVE of panic is JOLTING through h

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No HE’S NOT OKAY now just -- just -- DRIVE cause we can’t stop -- Eli? Eli? Help me out, man. Where do you keep it? Did you lose it? Eli's breaths have now become very scary RATTLES. He gest frantic to his pocket -- Jimmy FREAKING at the sight of Eli. He’s starting to lose color. Jimmy trembling. Eli PANICKING -- Jimmy slows -- -- Eli could die.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: What’re you gonna do?? What do we do? JIMMY --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (exhales, focuses) Calm down, we’re all gonna CALM DOWN -- that’s what we’re gonna do. (searching) Okay. I know this, I’ve seen this, we're gonna -- (gets in Eli’s face) -- we’re gonna be calm. Right? We’re gonna calm down and we’re gonna let this blow right over. Eli can’t. His eyes pleading. Very real fear. Jimmy nods, rallies, REACHES. Rolls down the WINDOW -- -- and he PULLS Eli in. Hangs on tight and takes Eli’s ha GRIPS them hard --  86.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Look -- look. I know it’s scary, but stay right here and breathe like me -- (inhales, long) In through the nose -- just -- like I'm doing right here -- now you -- Eli can’t. His eyes watering up. Forces himself to try.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Good -- out through the mouth. That’s it. Keep going... (repeats it) Again -- again -- we’re doing it like that. With rhythm. Right? (continues ) Breathe slow, breathe in that outside air.... Eli's trying. Afraid, but copying the gesture --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Cause we’re all good. We're off and away, all those guys? (breathes ) They're behind us, they’re gone now. We’re gonna get you a new puffer, brand new, soon as we can. -- and we see it. Jimmy’s got his rhythm now with Eli. El BREATHING begins to steady again, still RASPY, still scar

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (smiles, mimes) We’re just gonna chill -- we're gonna take those long, vacation breaths -- -- Eli's calming. The outside air, Jimmy’s words -- doing their thing. And as Jimmy sees the progress -- sees Eli coming back to him -- a surge of relief TEARS through Jim

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: There he is. That’s my brother -- that’s my brother right there -- Jimmy plays back the emotion. He has to, as though all of this was nothing. Up front, Milly’s chancing glances --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hang on to my hand, man. I got you. You just keep breathing. Like that.  87.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (after a moment) You scared me for a second -- Eli’s CHEST goes up and down. Up and down. Working on its accord, fighting its way back one slow breath at a time. SHOOM. Hal's TRUCK goes past LIKE A MISSILE. ONTO a FREEW ENTRY RAMP. A SIGN tells us we’re en route for UTAH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're BACK in the DECIMATED STRIP CLUB turned CRIME SCENE MARBLE-SIZED DEVICES float through the air. ACTIVATING an ILLUMINATING the scorched space. They SWIRL overhead. THE CLEANERS are here. Stepping forward into this rubble. The marble-sized devices flutter like mechanical bees. Th two Cleaners fanning out, SCANNERS in hand -- Approaching the POOL TABLE wreckage -- -- and setting up THREE BATTERED NODES in formation aroun it. A CLEANER punches a command into his SCANNER -- SHUNG. And the THREE NODES activate. GLOWING with life -- Before our eyes -- the POOL TABLE and rubble are scanned mapped. Waves of light fanning out, measuring... Followed by the location where Eli stood when he pulled t trigger -- the height and angle of the weapon when fired, then... FOOM. The open space before THE CLEANERS explodes with LI As though LIT BY THE BLAST that came from THE WEAPON at t exact moment when Eli pulled the trigger. A moment frozen We can see feint depictions of Milly, Jimmy, Lee, his cro right where they were the moment THE WEAPON was shot -- -- but the clearest face we can see is ELI. Closest to TH WEAPON’S discharge. The contours of his face recognizable The CLEANERS wade closer to Eli. Passing right through th holographic image, leaning down to stare him in the face. Threatening. Taking in the image of Eli holding one of th POSSESSIONS. And -- BOTH CLEANERS TURN FAST -- on alert -- able to sense or h something we can't.  88. Each reaches for back-mounted HOLSTERS. DRAWING WEAPONS similar to the one Eli took from them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan is pulling into the lot outside. In doing so, she spots the FAINT LIGHT coming from THE CLEANERS’ GEAR. Morgan pulls up, the light vanishes -- someone's in there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters. Gun and flashlight drawn. Cautious. Calls --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: FBI... anyone here better announce themselves -- No one does. Morgan moves further in. Eyes the BLAST DAMA in the dark. Flashlight illuminating this place in sliver A NOISE SOUNDS from the rear of the building. Morgan WHIR Starts forward. Another NOISE. CONFIRMS it. She CHARGES. STRAIGHT through shadow towards the back of club. Through a super SHITTY KITCHEN -- towards a SERVICE ENTRANCE -- SWAYING OPEN in the breeze -- We hear the start of ENGINES -- MORGAN SHOULDER CHECKS th SCREEN DOOR, racing into the dirt lot out back as -- THE CLEANERS, TWO FIGURES atop STREET BIKES CUT PAST HER. FLASH of their STRANGE, INHUMAN ARMOR catches her eye --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Stop RIGHT -- VROOOOM. They TEAR out of view around the building. Morga WHIRLS to give chase. RACING back through the club --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERGING out the front only to catch sight of TWO RED TAI LIGHTS on the way way faraway HORIZON. Already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IMPOSING VAN pulls into a 24-hour spot in the dead of night. TAYLOR, SNICK and SIX IMPOSING MEN get out. All ar looking exhausted.  89.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Gonna hit the head. Fill it up. Taylor moves for a set of RESTROOM DOORS ahead -- leaving obvious question trailing across the faces of his guys.

dialogues.speaker: SNICK
dialogues.text: Tay, man -- we, uh. (Taylor slows) Planning on stopping to rest?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Kid said Tahoe in the message. Which means we’re racing time. We'll sleep when they’re dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Milly sits behind the wheel of the truck at the ed of a cracked and weathered parking lot. Scanning the hori No movement. She looks. Over to Eli, seated next to her -

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Holding up? Eli nods. Low energy but better now. And we continue PULL

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO REVEAL --
dialogues.text: AT THE OTHER END OF THE LOT BEHIND THEM: is a countrified DRUG STORE with its front window SMASHED OUT. We can hear ALARM ringing faintly in the B.G. -- Jimmy is RUSHING up, his arms full of small prescription boxes. Grinning, he gets in --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Go! GO! Milly THROWS the truck into gear. PEELING away. Jimmy smi Offers up the prescription BOXES to Eli. Inside each is a different type of INHALER -- DIGGING through.

dialogues.text: I didn’t know which one to get -- so I grabbed em all --

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. UTAH HIGHWAYS
dialogues.text: Red dirt and swooping MESA now. Steadily traversing our w into the American West. Jimmy's at the wheel, wearing Lee cowboy hat like a war trophy and humming to the radio --  90. Milly's counting cash riding shotgun, dividing it into th even piles -- and Eli's leaning over her shoulder, watchi her count.

dialogues.speaker: MILLY
dialogues.text: Two hundred forty five k -- and -- exactly three hundred and sixty five bucks extra. (looks up, smiles) A dollar for every day of the year. That’s a good luck thing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: Milly's patrolling STORE SHELVES. Picks out a LOUD FASHIONED clutch purse, and nearby, a new PRE-PAID MOBILE AHEAD: Eli's at the register buying supplies.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Nine forty three. Eli offers up a hundred dollar bill. The ATTENDANT regard this a moment -- and reluctantly accepts. Moves to dig ch out of the drawer as Eli waits. While digging, the ATTENDANT SEES IT: ON THE NEWS playing directly over Eli's shoulder. IS A PH OF ELI. Next to a clear mug-shot of Jimmy. Wanted for involvement in robbery/murder investigation. From where he is, Eli can see Jimmy outside, palling arou with a group of small kids. He offers one the cowboy hat, retracts it -- Eli turns back to the Attendant. Offering his change with a word. Looking at Eli funny. Still, Eli accepts, nods a thank you and moves to go -- -- outside, Jimmy gives Lee's hat away to one of the kids They wave and shout goodbye as HAL'S TRUCK PULLS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: So we’re in Nevada now... you guys know what’s in Nevada, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An all-in tourist trap. Casino on the ground floor, hotel above, flanked by a pair of bars, trinket shops and a poo  gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BELLHOP leads Jimmy, Milly and Eli to a set of elevator The three stand silently in a line, Milly and Eli looking towards the casino floor, while Jimmy looks at his feet. OUT BEYOND: the CASINO FLOOR is alive with light and soun but Jimmy is in another place.
